Get Started in Minutes

Add one configuration entry to your MCP client and you're ready to go. No installation, no setup, no complexity.

1 Add to Your MCP Client Config

Cursor IDE

cursor_settings.json
{
  "mcpServers": {
    "anubis": {
      "command": "npx",
      "args": ["-y", "@hive-academy/anubis"]
    }
  }
}

Claude Desktop

claude_desktop_config.json
{
  "mcpServers": {
    "anubis": {
      "command": "npx",
      "args": ["-y", "@hive-academy/anubis"]
    }
  }
}

VS Code MCP

mcp_config.json
{
  "mcpServers": {
    "anubis": {
      "command": "npx",
      "args": ["-y", "@hive-academy/anubis"]
    }
  }
}

2 Restart Your MCP Client

Restart your IDE or MCP client to load the new server. The first run will automatically:

  • Download and install the latest version
  • Set up your project database
  • Initialize workflow rules and roles

3 Start Your First Workflow

Try these example commands in your AI assistant:

Create a new workflow
Can you help me set up a new React component workflow using Anubis - Divine Guidance for AI Workflows?
Get workflow guidance
Show me the available workflow roles and how to get started with the senior developer role.
